titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Earl E. Fisk Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 04:14

did.unittitle: Earl E. Fisk papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract:
Earl E. Fisk, British-born book collector, anthologist, writer, and insurance agent.
Collection includes correspondence, writings, and other materials. Correspondence contains letters to and from writers, publishers and others, including Alfred A. Knopf, Inc., Warren Beck, John Chipman Farrar, Farrar, Straus and Company, Harry Hansen, Robert Cortes Holliday, H. L. Mencken, A. Edward Newton, Carl Van Vechten, and Eudora Welty. Many of the letters concern Haldane Macfall. Writings include typescripts of articles by Fisk and others, and page proofs for Fisk's "Lovely Laughter: An Anthology of Seventeenth Century Love Lyrics". Other materials include specimen pages,illustrations, greeting cards and bookplates by Fisk, Claud Lovat Fraser, and others, and a detailed typescript list of Fisk's book collection.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Earl E. Fisk Papers are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Earl E. Fisk Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Restricted Fragile Papers in the portfolio may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies for reference use have been substituted in the main files.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. Portions of the correspondence were formerly cataloged in the Yale Collection of American Literature.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Earl E. Fisk, born in Britain in 1892, was an insurance agent, book collector, and casual literary agent to writers who were also his friends. After working as a professor of English at the University of Wisconsin, Fisk entered the insurance business, and became chairman of the National Association of Insurance Agents. At the same time, he continued collecting first editions of books by contemporary authors, including Max Beerbohm, A. E. Coppard, Claud Lovat Fraser, Holbrook Jackson, and A. Edward Newton. Although Fisk lived in Wisconsin for most of his adult life, he maintained a connection to the British literary scene. He actively promoted the work of authors whom he enjoyed, and he helped to place books by Haldane Macfall and Holbrook Jackson with American publishers. He also wrote many articles for The Bookman , and edited several books, including two collections of Elizabethan poetry and an edition of William Cobbett's Advice to Young Men and to Young Women .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
The Earl E. Fisk Papers contain letters, writings, printed material and other papers by and related to Earl E. Fisk. The papers have been arranged into three series. Series I, Correspondence
, consists primarily of letters from individuals, publishing companies and others to Fisk, as well as some of Fisk's replies. Many letters contain illustrated cards and bookplates. Series II, Writings
, contains proofs and typescripts of articles and other writings by Fisk and others. Series III, Other Papers
, contains Fisk's research files, consisting of lists, notes and newspaper clippings about book collecting and his own publications; printed materials, containing specimen pages, printed illustrations, and articles by various individuals; and other materials, consisting of a typescript list of Fisk's book collection, and lists of people to whom he sent Christmas cards.
Restricted Fragile Papers
contains materials from Series III.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Restricted Fragile Papers contains fragile originals, which may only be seen with the permission of the appropriate curator. Preservation photocopies have been substituted in the main files for the originals.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Port 116-117: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
